text:
cosmopolitan hotel is absolutely gorgeous. we gamed a little to kill time before our <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> time at 6:00pm. once we got there, it looked a little empty, just around the bar were full. we were seated right away, we had a nice view of the whole restaurant. 

we had two orders of fois gras french toast $22., tuna tartare $18., tuna sashimi $18., half a dozen oyster $18., and <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> salad. 

for <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> we had the sea bass - no good because it's not chilean sea bass. , bone in ribeye - prepared great, seared big eye tuna - tasty, beef short rib - my friend said very tender and good. 

<mark>Strawberry Cobbler</mark> $16 - fruity flavor with cr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> crusted rim 
dirty pearls $17 - vodka & blue cheese stuffed olives. it's different! 
white orchid $16. - not a sweet drink, smooth, vodka & slight gin 

we weren't going to have any dessert but was talked into ( in a good way) so we ordered the warm tres leches cake; dulce de leche - coconut sorbet - crispy m<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>. it was so sweet.!!

love this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>. i loved the stk franchises in nyc, and was excited to try the one in <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark>. 

food: (5 out of 5 stars) 
-bread - omg the bread is so delicious and the green olive oil dip thing was good!! i feel that other pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> over do the olive taste in the olive oil dip, but this was amazing and so good. the bread was also so tender and soft yet crunchy and warm on the outside. definitely enjoy your bread!!!
-steak loin strip - so tender and juicy and delicious!!! omg this was amazing.
-mac n cheese - omg i love their mac n cheese. get it!!! definitely worth it. 
-parmesan truffle fries - these are not like your typical fries. they're short and chunky, but they bring them out and it has just the right amount of parmesan topping (some pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> over due the parmesan). its super warm and crunchy on the outside while warm on the inside. 

drinks (5 out of 5)
-<mark>Strawberry Cobbler</mark> graham cr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> drink - if you're a girl, and u dont like the taste of alcohol and like sweet drinks, definitely get this!!! this was one of the better drinks i've drank in my life from a restaurant pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>. 
-j<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and coke - super strong. they definitely give you your j<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> for your monies.
-stk orgy shot - $15/shot or something like that, but it was good. esp for a girl who doesn't like the taste of alcohol. if you're here celebrating a special event and you're with a girl who can't take regular shots, definitely order this one!

atmosphere (4 out of 5)
i liked the atmosphere, but the one draw b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> was that the music was a lil loud. they were playing up to date music and nice remixes / mashups, which is nice. i'm not complaining about the music selection at all!! but the volume could have been turned down, especially for a sunday night <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>. 
the waiters were incredibly social and super chill. they were having the time of their lives while serving us and dancing around and clapping while on the job. 

perfect pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to go for a pre-clubbing pre-outing atmosphere. if youre going to marquee,  or a similar club , this is the perfect pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> for a pre-game <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> and drinks.  also recommended if you're looking for a non-buffet, nice sit down restaurant to celebrate a special occasion with good music and good food (as long as you don't mind the volume)

not super impressed by this fancy steak house.  i did like the ambience and the music made it very vegas-like, but the food itself wasn't that great.  the steak was too charred for my taste, so it felt over-powering and i couldn't really enjoy the tenderness or quality of the beef.  i was at flemings a few weeks earlier and <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> enjoyed their steak a lot more.  

i came with a large group and we tried pr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> all the appetizers and sides.  the favorites of the night were the beef tartare, pork belly, and mac & cheese.  everything else was bleh.  i didn't come to the steakhouse to eat sides and appetizers though, so the steak was the biggest let down.  <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> are pretty strong.  i had a <mark>Strawberry Cobbler</mark>, which is very martini like and definitely left me buzzed at the end of <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>!  the restaurant is really pretty though and the service was great.

pretty good! my steak was great, so was the m<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>. the bread looked amazing but <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> it wasn't that great... the drinks were super expensive, tried the <mark>Strawberry Cobbler</mark>- it was good, and something else that was more orangey and had prosecco in it, and it was tiny. i don't think this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> was as good as, say mastros... but it was good. a bit overpriced, nice atmosphere. kinda loud, but the music was fun. the sweet potato donuts were good as well!

the atmosphere is fun. they played great music that made me want to dance like i used to at frat parties.

the free blue cheese. read with chive olive oil was amazing. i could have eaten just the bread and been happy!

i had the <mark>Strawberry Cobbler</mark> martini - delicious. loved the fresh strawberries and graham cr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> crust. 

i had a small filet. it was fine, but nothing too special. it was cooked more in the middle than the outside?!

the sides were delicious. we had the mac and cheese and potato au gratin. both were fantastic.

fun fun fun, a steakhouse cannot get as entertaining as this one. the bar scene in <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> is very stylish, with great dj spinning good music in the b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>, and yet the tables are set at <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> distance allowing for private conversations, stk is such energetic steakhouse fit for great food as well as people watching. i just love the vibe of this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>!

the <mark>Green Intensity</mark> martini is exicting, spicy and refreshing.
the tuna tartar was really yummy, especially love <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> oil on the side, really brings out the flavor of the tuna.
the baked bread with blue cheese butter was one of the best bread i have tasted in any restaurants, so innovative!
the filet medallion was done just right, i savored every bite of it.
<mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> sauce on the side was excellent.  
parmesan truffle fries was good, but didn't really tasted the truffle.

this is the kind of pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> you would want to return again and again~

i absolutely love you guys!!! the food, the servers, and anyone else who works there. from the minute i walk in to the minute i leave, it's an experience. which is why i constantly return e<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> week. the specials never fail to disappoint, the drinks r amazing.. i suggest the <mark>Green Intensity</mark>.. it's ridiculously tasty and my favorite.. jalapeno, gin, lime, basil.. the atmosphere is always very happy, uplifting, they have the greatest djs especially on magnum mondays for industry nights and their resident dj roger gangi always spins some great tunes and is very friendly.. the servers are all very knowledgeable with the menu and can offer some great suggestions, they are very attentive, polite, friendly, and welcoming. the drinks and food always arrive within a  timely manner.. you can often find the manager george visiting the tables to check on how your food and service is going. i just absolutely am in love with this spot.. look forward to many more visits!

we had one of the most fun <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> experiences here last saturday night.  we were celebrating my friend's b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> at stk just kept the party going for us.

stk is definitely not a quiet steakhouse.  it is a straight up party!  we waited in the bar area while our table for 7 was getting set up.  we had <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> drinks and within 3 tr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> i was in love with the dj.  yes, a dj, spinning in a round booth sm<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> dab in the middle of the restaurant.  

after about 10 minutes a hostess seated us at our booth.  not long after our waiter martin came by.  when martin was explaining the days specials i literally stopped him as jay z starting pumping through the speakers and i belted out to him while waving my hands up and down... "turn my music hi-hi-hi-hi-gher!!"  it was epic... but you had to be there!  we all had <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and proceeded to order.

some of the tasty craft cocktails we had throughout our meal were the <mark>Cucumber Stiletto</mark>, the lemoncello & raspberry martini, <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> with hibiscus flower in it, and iced te<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>.

a wonderful warm bread was brought out to the table.  it was soft and warm and yummo.  it had a light dipping sauce with it. soon after our starters came out.  the heirloom tomato and burrata with pesto was good and i was very surprised at how good <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> and avocado salad was.  i was not even thinking of ordering it but i'm glad we did.  it was reminiscent of a spring roll almost.  it was fresh and wonderful.  i wish we got two.

our main courses came out and mine was <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> favorite.  i got the short rib and it was lovely.  there were <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> orders of the sea bass,  a filet, and the tuna tartar.  

i love sides... see my "last meal" in the about me section.   stk's side dishes were delicious.  we sha<mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>, mushroom pot pie, the fries, green beans, and mac n cheese. 

we had a really fun experience here, somewhere along the ride, "shots!" was played by the dj and servers were coming out with trays full of shots of alcohol and handed them out to our table among others.  there was also an older white guy that was getting down on <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark>.  he literally hoped up on his booth and table and was rocking out to "play that funky music"

super fun, super pricey, but it's vegas baby.... "you're so money and you don't even know it!"

i expected so much more from this restaurant. 
we had an early reservation before a show, seated promptly ( pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> was empty at 6 on a friday). started with <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> <mark>Cucumber Stiletto</mark> cocktail, very good. moved on to several dishes beginning ( party of 4) with:
truffle fries - oily, poorly seasoned
beef carp<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> - sooo good, great flavor
tartare - fresh, great presentation
beet salad - big hit, beets w: gorgonzola, super fresh and tasty.
lobster cocktail - tinie, tiny.. claw portion with small bits of lobster in tomato broth = absolute waste of money.
for our entrees we had 2 steaks, risotto, seared ahi, side spin<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and mac n cheese.
all of the entrees were good, not mind blowing or memorable - just good. the mac n cheese should be removed from the menu - horrible. the spin<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> was boring, flavorless. 
the only spark during this experience was our server - she was awesome. 
i definitely won't return, having sampled several items and only appreciating 2 ( beet , carp<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>) of them... it's not enough to bring me b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>.

i went here for my birthday <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> last week and had the best time. my birthday fell on a monday, which is a special night at stk as they host a dj and really get the party going. they keep the lighting low, music loud and energy high, making it the perfect pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to get the party started!

i started with the <mark>Cucumber Stiletto</mark> which was crisp and refreshing. we started the meal with the pear & endive salad, tuna tartare, and a buffalo mozzarell<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> over bread (which they made special for us since we had a vegetarian <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> with us that evening). all appitizer dishes exceeded my expectations. i'm not really a fish eater, but i tried the tuna tartare, and loved it!. for the main dishes, my group shared the vegetarian risotto, sea bass over mushroom risotto and loin strip steak. for sides, we got <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>, mashed potatoes, and green beans. everything was excellent. at the end of the meal they came out with <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> br\u00fbl\u00e9e with happy birthday written on the dish. i loved every minute at stk and i plan to come b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> the next time i'm in vegas.

i came on a saturday night with a party of 5.  we had 7pm reservations and they sat us ex<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> on time!  the restaurant has a very cool dark sexy vibe.  it is very noisy.. super load music.  

bread with blue cheese butter and chive oil - 4.5 stars - really enjoyed this dish.  large load of bread crisp on the outside but very soft in the inside.  just a hint if blue cheese flavor in the butter.  delish!

<mark>Cucumber Stiletto</mark> - 4 stars - very good fresh light drink!
butternut squash risotto - 4 stars - this dish had a lot of complex flavors. short rib and risotto was cooked nicely.  the flavors in the sauce on short ribs prevailed over the butternut squash.  the short rib sauce is a veal reduction with red wine and a strong nutmeg finish.  
crab ravioli - 3.5 to 4 stars -pasta was perfectly cooked, sauce was light.  a very delicate dish.  the taste of crab was almost lost. ad<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> a touch more crab would perfect this dish.
burrata - 3 stars - burrata itself was amazing but bread was too soft and dish would have beed better with fresh tomatoes and olives rather than a tapenade 
corn pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> - 4 stars - super corn delicious!  but i love corn!
bok choy - 3 stars
haricot vert - table said 4 stars.  i didn't try them
1/2 lobster - 4 stars - just slightly over cooked but really ever so slightly
filet w/ b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> butter - 4 stars - this filet was cooked perfectly to medium rare as requested.  nice and tender. add
truffles fries - 4.5 stars - i normally do not like thick fries but these were really really good!

other things ordered at our tables caesar salad, iceberg salad, sole, skirt steak, brussels sprouts and tuna.  i did not try these dishes but table consensus was salads were very good but brussels sprouts and entrees were all just ok and no one would order them again.

we ended the night with a fire ball shot (who's idea was that?) and the bread pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>!  the bread pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> is not traditional.  it is more like <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>.. definitely not as dense as normal bread pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>.  i like <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> crunch pieces as the added a little extra something something!

amy was our server and she was excellent!  service overall was impressive!

unfortunately, i probably won't come here again as it is just too noisy and you have to know what to order to really enjoy your meal.  however, if you are a group of singles looking for a good time this is your pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>!  this seems like a major pick up joint to see and be seen!

stk is such a fun, hip, really most happening pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> in vegas. i will come b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> here times and times again, since it's become one of my fav. stopped by here for <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> last week when in lv! every time this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> is consistently excellent!
drinks: decided on <mark>Cucumber Stiletto</mark> and omg - it is incredible! 
food: started with the signature bread rolls (you ju<mark>Zinfandel, St. Francis, Sonoma, CA 12</mark>'t stop eating them!), then had tuna tartar - really fresh tuna with delicate spice to it, awesome presentation. then had pork belly and wow - so good!! my choice of the meal was beet salad and beef carp<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> (both dishes are a must try!!!). food arrived within minutes and service was fantastic. can't wait to come b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>!

i recently moved to las vegas from miami and can honestly say this is the best restaurant las vegas has to offer. the seafood is fresh, specialty cocktails are made with care & the steaks are cooked to perfection! 

there is a dj right by the bar and it really adds to the great atmosphere. i have (almost ) tried everything on the menu and can happily recommend: 

tuna tartar: highest grade of tuna
seafood platter: freshest ever! coming from miami i am a seafood snob and this platter always surpasses my expectations! 
dover sole: the brown butter sauce is a+++
bone-in filet: lean yet flavorful
truffle fries: thick cut so different from other restaurants 
lobster mashed potatoes: self explanatory as to why these are a must
sweet potato donuts: made fresh and melt in your mouth :)  

what really makes stk stand out from most restaurants is that the management touches base with the tables. for such a busy restaurant to do this is nothing short of amazing and such attention to detail is what keeps me coming b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> for more. 

throw on <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> dress, grab your girlfriends (or significant other) and treat yourself to a night at stk. order the <mark>Cucumber Stiletto</mark>, people watch, and enjoy a filet; you'll thank me later!

i had high hopes for stk and unfortunately they were not quite met. we went on a bustling friday night and were immediately seated in the bar area. i love the look of the pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>; from <mark>The Orange Whip</mark> washed brick to <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> slotted walls. the decor is very hip and trendy. there is even a dj, but beware it does get quite loud in there. the lighting was also a little weird, my husband basically had a spotlight on his side of the table and anytime something white (a plate or napkin) hit the light it was blin<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>. 

after taking in the scenery, we were greeted with melted bleu cheese bread with <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> dipping sauce. bleu cheese is one of those things that you either love or hate and unfortunately i hate it. i found it an odd choice since it does have such a strong flavor, but i was able to enjoy the middle of the bread and the sauce was very different from anything i had tasted before.

we started with the foie gras french toast and it was disgusting! it is literally french toast, a roasted apple, and a giant slab of foie gras. i can see how it would work for some people but it just didn't work at all for me. we went out on a limb on this one and we fell out of the tree!

my husband got the bone in rib-eye and it was heaven. it was the perfect combination of fat and meat. i had the small filet and it was also spect<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>. it was tender, even though i like my meat on the well done side. we didn't opt for any toppings but we did try <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> sauce and it really wasn't worth it. the steaks came with a small side of onions and they were an unexpected highlight. i had regular sauteed onions but my husband had spicy onions that were delicious with the steak. they absolutely know how to cook a mouth-watering steak here!

we also tried 2 sides, but both were disappointing. the mac and cheese would be absolutely stunning if it had any flavor at all. it has a perfect crispy topping and is cheesy but there is really no flavor. even a little salt would have taken the dish to the next level. 

we also tried the mushroom pot pie. when the server brought it out i was so excited to dive into it, but then the unthinkable happened, he cut the top off and dumped it on a plate! i wanted to scream out, but resisted the urge. the mushroom flavor was so overpowering and i love mushrooms. it really needed more pastry, we only had the thin top and it was buried under all the filling. it was so sad.

overall, the service was great and the steak was delicious, but what's a steak without sides? there are many other pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> in vegas that can cook a great steak and provide me with excellent side options. sorry stk you and i are just not meant to be.

we came here for <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>, and while <mark>The Orange Whip</mark> truffle risotto and carp<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> were incredible, we waited well over an hour for our steaks. were they hunting <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> outside or something? we spent over $600 on wine and they couldn't give us a reason as to why it was taking so long. 

our waitress came over and tied to schmooze us, but when i have been waiting well over an hour for my steak, shmooze all you want but it won't work. we ordered at 7pm and it's now 8:23 and nothing.

stk feels more like a lounge than a steakhouse. the ambiance is trendy, the music is turned up a notch, while the <mark>Martini</mark> are stiff and ice cold. the only problem (and it's a big problem) is that the food is a bit sub-par. granted, the meat is slightly above average, but the sides and appetizers were too small and l<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> flavor. (sides are crucial with a good steak!) i guess i expected a little....well, <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> a lot more if i'm dropping a few hundred per person.  oh well, at least i got to take a picture with flava flav. i'm a loser.

trendy steakhouse with a lounge opens on weekend nights till 1am, and dj spinning, definitely not your daddy's steakhouse like they advertised. we had <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> of drinks there over the weekend, they didn't have cocktail waitresses serve at the lounge area, with $18-22 e<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> specialty cocktails there, i would like to have some service over drinks..... at least the drinks were yummy and strong.

decor / ambience: 4
food: 5
service : 3.5

total bill for 2 with 2 <mark>Martini</mark> no desert: $216

a small restaurant, seatings are kind of crowded, especially for 2 people, i saw many people got uncomfortable with their seats.  but at least it was intimate enough. it is also not a bad idea to eat at the lounge area if you don't make reservations.

our food: 
complimentary bread with special house dipping sauce: sooo yummy! one of the best i've ever had

dozen fresh oysters : so fresh and yummy with special house sauce and cocktail sauce

dungeness crab salad: not much salad, but the dungeness crab was so delicious

10oz fillet mignon: delicious, perfectly cooked to medium rare with red wine sauce

big eye tuna: soooo delicious! cooked perfectly to medium rare with wasabi mashed potato

mushroom pot pie: yummy! the portion was like an appetizer 

food was so delicious, flavorful enough without saltiness. lemon drop martini was good, grey goose dry martini was strong, you can choose stuffed olives or regular ones. 

the service was just above average for an expensive fine steakhouse, we weren't very impressed. but he did a good job, friendly, fast and somewhat attentive. 

loved the food, not so much for the entire <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> experience. but still a sexy restaurant for a sexy <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> date sometime.

$18 for a strawberry rhubarb martini???? it is hard to complain about the price when they are oh-soooo delicious.  luckily i am a vegetarian so i drank my steak budget.  i will make my way b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to this spot for their <mark>Martini</mark> and mashed potatoes.

service:  okay.
food:  epically delicious.
atmosphere:  entertaining ... seems to be attr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> an upscale jersey shore type crowd.

i'd come here again for the sliders again and happily pay way too much for them, they were just that good, but i would be fearful that my friends and i would end up sitting behind a table with hair gel ken and stiletto barbie screaming "more <mark>Martini</mark>!" all night and it wouldn't be the most fun.

our favey steakhouse in vegas. atmosphere is cool, decor too, and dj spinning music! all food is great but <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> corn pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> and the bleu cheese olives in the <mark>Martini</mark> is what keeps us coming b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>! steaks are great and the bleu cheese bread to start us super yumm! risotto with truffles was yumm too!

amazing atmosphere especially following any concert venue here!  great vibe;  great <mark>Martini</mark>, wonderful wine list, amazing steaks!  love the decor--
amazing music-  gorgeous people !!!!!

ambiance is great at this swanky, pre-clubbing restaurant. 5 stars for people watching and evening dress competitions. 

we liked <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark><mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> that literally fell off your fork, and the <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> angel hair presto pasta was a great. (the <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> sauce was a little too sweet.) 14oz. peppercorn sirloin was solid and not too peppery, but the filet medallion was merely good -- not top-notch meat quality in either case. cocktails were very well done, especially the absolut elixer <mark>Martini</mark>.

i ju<mark>Zinfandel, St. Francis, Sonoma, CA 12</mark>'t believe it took so long for me to check this phenomenal joint out!!

bok choy - weird for a steak pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> but it was kinda spicy.  very flavorful though with lots of soy sauce and garlic.  not bad <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> for some greens.

appetizers:

they give you this baked loaf of bread with parmesan and garlic sprinkled over the top. it comes with a dipping sauce of herb infused butter oil. it is really a tasty treat.

entrees:

mushroom pot pie:    this is a great dish to order on the side. its basically mushrooms saut\u00e9ed with caramelized onions and cream sauce in a little pot pie. i enjoyed scooping out the mushrooms and drizzling them over my steak. the flavor combination was intense.


the wine list is pretty good and we ordered a bottle of pinot noir. i forgot which one, but the waiter said its very popular and you should buy this in a full bottle.


dessert:   they have a pist<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and strawberry cake that is baked on an almond and marzipan coated crust. it is served with whipped cream and drizzled with strawberry sauce and its amazing! it is very light and not too heavy and a great way to end your meal.


this is a pricy restaurant, but its worth visiting when you are in vegas for a special <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> or night out with friends. one of the better steakhouses in las vegas!

awesome atmosphere! great pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to have <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> with a group of people, or a date. <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> bread was a definite winner! my braised short rib fell short in the flavor department, but was extremely tender.

food was great. we had the lobster mash and the rib eye steak....it was amazing! brad was our server and i have to say it was ok. for a high end restaurant i was a bit disappointed. my girlfriends and i wanted to have a great birthday <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> and catch up without feeling rushed through <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>. we can tell he was a tad annoyed because attitude changed when we told him we were in no hurry and we wanted to take our time. it was clear to us he wanted to turn tables. it's not like we were not consuming because we were ordering drinks left and right! not sure if i would come b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> here. food was great but it all about the service don't you think? so 3 stars for service!

closes later than other steakhouses. i didn't want to rush to a different steakhouse 30min before their closing time. 

came on a monday night. took 5-10min to get a table. it was crazy loud and pr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> like <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>. wasn't a big fan of that. our waiter was super polite and friendly. checked on us regularly. 

yellowtail appetizer was yummy. fresh and it surprisingly goes well with apples. it also has <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> sauce that comes with it. 
my boyfriends bone-in ribeye was okay. wasn't juicy enough. had better. 
i got the bone-in filet. asked for medium rare. was slightly over cooked in my opinion. but the portion by the bone was amazing.
we both got the stk sauce. their house steak sauce was sweeter than i expected. the boyfriend wasn't a big fan, but i thought it was okay. i think the stk bold would have been a better choice. 
we sha<mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> corn pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>. that was a favorite. tasted like a sweet mashed potato with pieces of corn. 

overall, the food was okay.

this was among the best meals i have ever had. when choosing a location for my birthday <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> i went b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and forth and eventually we settled on stk. we made a reservation and went. truly, everything about this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> was phenomenal. the service was on point, the food was amazing and the atmosphere was so much fun, i mean, really, a dj spinning at <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>? ok!

our service was wonderful. we were checked on at all the appropriate times, our server was attentive but never pushy and clearly knew the menu very well. 

i started with the shrimp rice krispies and then had <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> filet with a side of mac & cheese for <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>. everything was amazing. i still can't get over the taste of the mac & cheese. oh, and did i mention the bread? yeah, amazing.

finally, the atmosphere was so much fun and the people watching was phenomenal. i love people watching and there were lots of interesting and unique people to watch while <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> at stk. there was also a dj spinning but the music was kept at a very reasonable volume so that we could enjoy our <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> company.
dish_name: Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV
Veuve Cliquot, Yellow Label Brut, Champagne NV
Moet & Chandon, Imperial Brut Rose, Champagne NV

text:
my party of 4 came here for <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> and was greeted by great service. our server was friendly, and attended to our food complaints professionally.

bread with blue cheese sauce and chive olive oil - this was rather adventurous and i really enjoyed it since i'm a fan of blue cheese. unfortunately, my friends didnt enjoy it quite as much :( to e<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> its own!

beef tartare with bl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> truffle, sliced radish, soy caramel - love how the fragrance of the bl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> truffle brought out the freshness of the beef. the potato chip was also very fresh. really enjoyed this.

pork belly with soy glaze, pickled radish and ginger - the first time this was served, the pork belly was over cooked so much that it was tough and chewy. not great. had to send this b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>. the second time was much better and more well seasoned, though still a little too tough for my liking. i'd give this a pass.

lil brgs (wagyu sliders) - super good!! we didnt add truffles or foie gras, but if i had <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> to do this again, i'd definitely try ad<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> both!

medium sirloin steak - the best steak of the night. steak was beautifully cooked, soft, easily cut, and had a layer of fats making the steak not too dry. definitely recommended.

medium filet with foie gras topping - steak was slightly too dry for my liking, but foie gras was beautifully cooked. 

medium rare filet medallion - the first time this was served, the beef was way overcooked. it was so cooked that it tasted overly-charred, and the beef was definitely past medium rare. we had this sent b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and the beef was perfectly cooked the second time round. recommended!

sides:
mushroom pot pie - this was yummy, but way too salty. there is no way the pot pie can be this salty. we contemplated sen<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> this b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> too, but by then have given up on having our food sent b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> so we just ate it anyway.

truffle fries - omg so good. must order. freshly cut potato with truffles. can't go wrong.

mac and cheese - decent but ok to pass.

the bill came up to be about $330 before tips, inclu<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> a bottle of <mark>Riesling, Anew, Columbia Valley, WA 12</mark> is pretty ok. ambience was nice with great music. 

4 stars for food (after they finally got it right), but unfortunately having to send food b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> twice is un<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> for a fine <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> restaurant, hence -1 star. thankfully, the waiter handled it professionally and made sure we were very satisfied with our food.

dish_name: Sauvignon Blanc, Cloudy Bay, Marlborough, NZ 14

text:
updated review: (marked down to 3 stars).

we had such a great experience here during the grand opening that we decided to go b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> a week later with a friend visiting from out of town.  the experience was not as great.  here is the low down:

host staff:  clueless.
we made reservations a few days in advance and asked to sit with our server from our first visit.  on the night of our <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> we arrived 20 minutes early to see plenty of open tables but the hostess was absolutely clueless on what to do with us.  uh, seat us maybe?  we gave her a break and decided to sit in the lounge for a drink while she sorted it out but after 30 minutes (10 minutes after our reservation) we never got appro<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> about our table (except for the wrong name - "are you mr. kluss"?) and so we had to go b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> up to the stand to find out what was going on with the <mark>Malbec, Terrazas De Los Andes Altos Del Plata, AR 13</mark>.  the hostess seemed like she was making an excuse up (similar to lost homework judging from her age) as to why our table still wasn't ready and so we ended up having to talk to another hostess to get it right.  when they finally went to sit us down it wasn't in the servers area we had twice requested (once during our reservation a week before and once when we arrived).  when we let her know of the mistake the hostess seating us (a different one) made some rude remark about how 'messed up' things were here and sat us down in the section we requested.  not a good tee-off to a $260 <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> for 3.

<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>: too slow and with mistakes.
the best part of <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> was the demeanor from or original server.  she was a real pro and as cool as we remembered the first time but seemed to be hamstrung by the slow kitchen service and a few lapses in attention to detail from there - missing or slow items she had to notice and then retrieve.  i'm no stranger to fine <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> and a slow p<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> is nice but it took a good 40 minutes just to get our apps - thats too long.  overall the food was just "okay" for as long as we waited and for the price.  i've been much more impressed at half a dozen other steakhouses in town (the palm @ caesars, capital grill, ruths chris's, del friscos, flemings etc).  really surprised too that <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> were made so inconsistently (in taste) because how complicated is <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>?  it was so left to right that we had to keep saying something to the point that the server felt bad enough to finally bring us an extra (right) one for free.

summary:
like the other reviewer our trouble started with the front host staff and unfortunately continued with slow service.  as native las vegans we like <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> a lot as far as hotels go and may give stk another shot after we've tried the other restaurants at the hotel first.  the layout is great, the decor, the music and the overall vibe are solid too but as far as service goes and food that blows you away goes - maybe they just have opening week issues.

caveat emptor.

hostess and wait staff were perfectly <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>, although it was a monday night and i guess they weren't super busy. our party of 5 showed up without a reservation around 7, 730pm and were seated within 10 minutes. our drinks from the bar hadn't even arrived so they were brought to our booth. 

ambience was great, a dj was spinning some excellent tunes (think bennie and the jetts) - although music was a bit loud for conversation.

i had the 10 oz. filet and my friend had the organic chicken. i loved <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> on my steak. the steak was tender and flavorful despite the f<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> that i opted out of any additional toppings/sauce for my steak (i'm a purist). <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> was very soft and moist, although the portion was very small.

we shared sides:
-mac and cheese (standard, nothing special. i consider myself a mac  n cheese connoisseur and i like a good crispy crust with cheesy al dente pasta but this was more <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> white concoction that i wasn't in love with)
-parmesan truffle fries (not shoe string but more like perfectly rectangular steak fries, st<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> kinda like jenga. pretty good but again, nothing to die for)
-roasted carrots (baby yellow and orange market carrots - delicious, tender, flavorful)
-mushroom pot pie (presentation was great. they bring it out in it's little pot, cut around the top of <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> and dump the dish out upside down onto another plate. presentation was better than the flavor - basically different mushrooms in <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> sauce, but still fun.)

 overall: my steak did it for me. i'd go b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>.

stopped for <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> a few nights after the grand opening. bartender was friendly and i loved my drink. best part about the experience though, was <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> dj spinning away!

where do you start with this one?
lets see...awesome location ...decent design.   playlist was awful and did not match the vibe that the design offers.
 i couldn't even hear my server who was very kind...helpful.
..and knowledgeable.  thank you mike!
way over staffed...which i'm sure had everything to do with the holiday and opening week...but they were just stan<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> around like flies and chatting away...inclu<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> management.  didn't look professional and felt crowded.
there were only two restrooms that were unisex.  the attendant was not ten<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> to them adequately.   the seats were wet and toilets weren't flushed.

some interesting food items on the menu but only <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> lived up to their hype.  sauces were disappointing in comparison to their house sauce and some proportions were off for the elaborate or eccentric culinary menu items they were trying to <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>.

the steaks were cooked to true temp and very good quality and the blue cheese dressing was gourmet.

i didn't have <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to look at the wines and the desert menu was minimal and not very creative.

overall. think they need time to grow but then again...its vegas and i hear that it is a fun late night pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>...but anywhere with cheap cocktail waitress dresses usually is.  i may try it again....but mainly because it is at my new favorite hotel!

food was pretty good, could have been better...

service was fast and sharp thought it better be due to that they had too many staff members who were just stan<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> around. 

music was too loud where u have to almost yell to talk and the music selection was ju<mark>Zinfandel, St. Francis, Sonoma, CA 12</mark>...

one thing i love was the hostess... totaly hottie , i would go b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> jus tto see her

i'd give it 2.5 stars but someone needs to fix the music issue and hopefully a low side vote will encourage it.  (btw, there is a big fr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> knob for the volume. turn it counter-clockwise)


like many of the reviews on here, i was hoping for awesome and i got moments of cool with whole smattering of  average. i have eaten at 90% of the steakhouses here in town and i have a pretty good feel for what is hip and cool. 

ambiance-
the music is way to fr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> loud. it's bad form to have to yell at my wife who is 3 feet away from me during <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>.  i have 6000 watt home theater with 4 18 inch subs so i'm not in the "if it's too loud your too old club".  

but for an upscale steakhouse in an amazing casino it's just amateurish. i get concepts and this one just sucks. 

nor is this the pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to bring clients to discuss business. it is however a good pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to bring inlaws because you won't be able to hear them.

annoyance f<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> minus 2 stars

food-
we asked for a heavy peppercorn rub on our steaks so much so that the steaks would be "ruined" with pepper. they brought our steaks cooked perfectly to temp and with a thick coating of peppercorns.  perfect! i had the stk bold sauce and my wifey had <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> horseradish. my sauce was good if not a bit too sweet and the horseradish cream sauce was blah. 

we had the truffle fries (loved), asparagus (good as it can be) and mac and cheese(eh, cheesier and more crunch please)

if i had to find fault it would be that food came out a bit too quick. it was about 5 or so minutes after the apps were completed. 

overall n9ne, botero and brand have a better product. 

minus .5 stars


staff- 
the foh girls were cute, dressed well and very friendly.  no complaints here. 
bar staff was interesting- my bartender told me her signature drink was <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and basil martini. she said was it amazing and i asked, is she so sure that she will buy it if i don't like it? she said no.  fair enough, except the bartender next to her had a group of folks come in. couldn't tell if they were friends or business but there were 8 of them in the group and he proceeded to make them all drinks and then tell the group that the whole round was on them.  hmmm....
i joked to my girl if i could be part of their group. she didn't get it. oh and <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> martini at union is way better. 

our waiter was awesome as was the buss staff.  he was polite, fun and knowledgeable about the menu.  


i probably won't be b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> as i'd rather go to n9ne or botero for the same price and not have to <mark>Malbec, Terrazas De Los Andes Altos Del Plata, AR 13</mark> with the fr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> music. plus n9ne has <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> vibe that is way more  my liking than "steak at the roxbury" feel of stk.

ah stk the pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to be seen and to mingle. as soon as you walk into this restaurant you notice all the beautiful people, loud music, and dim atmosphere. the hostess sits you in round booths that are so close to your neighbor by the end of the night you might have new friends. you order a round of their signature cocktails and soak in the glitz and the glam. but is it worth all the hype and the $$$? 

service - our waitress was awesome. she was very detailed when going over the menu (maybe a little too much) and was more than obliged to offer her recommendations. she was on top of her game and provided excellent service to our table. i was a little intimidated by the bussers as they were like vultures as soon as you finished a dish. they also swooped in to fold the napkin on the table everytime my date got up from the table. side note: just make sure to say you ordered sparkling water so they don't pour regular tap water when they see your glass almost empty. tap & sparkling do not mix well.

food - within minutes of being sat down, you are greeted with <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> parmesan garlic roll and it's dipping oil, which i can't remember what it was off the top of my head. the roll wasn't bad. 

we order our cocktails and appetizers - tuna tartare & foie gras french toast. phenomenal! both were so refreshing and hit that palate perfectly. the tuna tartare was fresh with diced jalapenos, onions and lime in a t<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> shell with a avocado puree and chili oil. the foie gras french toast was balanced excellently. the toast in a sherry reduction and the foie gras perfectly cooked, sprinkled with powdered sugar and served with a po<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> apple made happy time in my mouth! i highly recommend these two apps. 

we then ordered a medium rare bone-in fillet with a side of parmesan truffle fries, mac & cheese, mushroom pot pie and steamed alaskan crab legs. the fries were not like the usual shoestring fries you find around town, they were more like steak potato blocks, not bad if i say so myself. the mushroom pot pie is good for mushroom fiends. they bring it out as a pot pie and cut the top off and dump the filling on a plate for you. the alaskan crab legs were nicely plump and sweet, oh how i miss the northwest! 

now for the main entree- for being a steakhouse i was disappointed that their steak did not live up to the hype. it was cooked perfectly but had no flavor! a little salt & pepper would have made it one of the top steaks in town. maybe the reason it's so bland is because they do give you an option to add a topping or sauce to your steak. however, i'm a purist and great steak doesn't need anything fancy on it if seasoned right. the waitress brought us their steak sauces to try and honestly i wasn't impressed by them. the flavor was so bland. the mushroom & peppercorn sauce was probably the better of the 4 but it still l<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> flavor. word of advice don't order the mac & cheese, no flavor whatsoever. i couldn't tell you if it was suppose to be a truffle mac & cheese or just a white mac & cheese (best mac & cheese: stripsteak's truffle mac & cheese). 

wait still not done! we had to top off the night with dessert to have the whole stk experience. we ordered a molten chocolate cake and the famous bread pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>. if you have a sweet tooth, these two desserts will rock your world. i did like the bread pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> but it was a little too sweet for me as it was drenched in <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> syrup. <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> crunch addition to the bread pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> was quite interesting. 

when all was said and done, we got are bill and walked away stuffed. we easily spent over $200 for the 2 of us but we also wanted to have the full stk experience. overall, <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to be if you don't mind the loudness, dark lighting and have <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> hours to kill...our <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> lasted over 2 hours. 

side notes:  the timing between apps and entrees seemed so spread out. i feel like we waited 15-20 for our entree to come out, could be a bad thing if you're starving. the steak was a disappointment but willing to try it again or try something else. be prepared to wait in line to use the restroom as there is only one stall per gender. make reservations as it can get crowded.

yummy!!!

we were at stk this past weekend for an engagement celebration.  the staff was so nice and so <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>!!!  the food is mostly very good!!!  i know this is a steak house, but i am not a steak fan so i opted for the dover sole...i thought it was a little overcooked.  however, that was the only thing i didn't care for!!!  we ordered tons of appetizers and sides...hamburger sliders, shrimp rice krispy thingys, crab salad, some sort of roll thing, sweet corn, m<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>, mushrooms, and <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> that i am forgetting!!!  the m<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> is my favorite!!!  i think i ate a whole one myself!!!  they brought out <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> lav<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> that we all shared...very good, as well!!!

overall, this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> is a bit pricey, but has very solidly decent food...oh...and very good drinks!!!  

i almost forgot...this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> is like eating in <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>...they have a dj!!!  the music was awesome and everyone in the restaurant  was singing....very fun time!!!

ok, so we <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> at stk two nights in a row.  why? the food was outstan<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> and james our waiter (both nights) was equally hospitable in his top notch service.  there were a few tiny hitches however george the gm was incredibly authentic in his management style which we completely appreciated and his appro<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to seeing his restaurant as successful was very appealing. 

one thing you must know is that the 80's music is loud.  if you are of the age that enjoys that period, you will find it hard not to chair dance or mouth the words to many favorite songs.  some <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> had to get up and dance!  great to go with friends for a fun night out.  maybe not appropriate for a <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> meeting... i don't think you'd get any work done.

it's new... give it a try, your taste buds will be happy!  and ask for james as your server.  you will be pleased you did.

four hours of my life i'd like to have b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>!

the food...3 stars; loud, uncool music... negative 1 star; not honoring a reservation made 2 months in advance until an hour after the reservation time...negative 1 star; taking a reservation for 12, when not a table in the pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> is big enough for comfortably sit 8...negative 1 star.

ok, i won't be going b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to stk.  

it's way too loud for anything except a dance club, let alone a (theoretical) steak restaurant...they're trying too hard to be cool.  this means not even a two person table could have a <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> conversation; but if a <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> date without talking is for you, then this could be the pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>.  might as well bring earplugs...the 80s music isn't worth listening to anyway.

not a pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> for large parties.  i planned on a nice <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> with a group of friends and celebrating a birthday.  shame on stk for even taking a reservation for 12 and confirming it 24 hours ahead of time, if the restaurant isn't set up for large groups.  almost all of the tables are fixed booths, so there's no re-arranging...and the booths are pretty much 6 to 8 people comfortably.  it would have been nice to have known, before everyone is sitting in e<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> other's lap for an expensive <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>.

the waiter was pleasant and efficient, the food was ok.  host staff was useless.

i was a guest at <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark>, but stk is the worst part of the hotel.

bread for the table:  o.m.g!  i'm sure all the other yelpers have commented on how amazing this bread is.  it even looks amazing - coming out in the shape of a muffin glazed with deliciousness with a green side dipping sauce that takes you b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> for a moment because it's green.  when you get over the awe and <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> dig in to eat it, it just melts in your mouth - one of those crispy and buttery on the outside, and soft on the inside.  and that dipping sauce!!!  

foie gras appetizer: i indulged with foie gras ever since california banned it (not necessarily banned it completely, but it might as well have been with the restrictions).  i ordered both the appetizer and the side to go on top of my steak.  the foie gras was excellent - cooked perfectly - tender - juicy - fatty!  unfortunately it was paired with a sweet element - i can't even remember what it was (applesauce, berries? no clue) - all i remember was that it did not compliment well.  i separated the two and only focused on the foie gras.  

filet mignon with foie gras: have already commented on the awesomeness of the foie gras and it didn't disappoint.  however, the piece that came with the entree was much smaller than the appetizer.  if i could go b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>, i'd order two appetizer ones, and save one to eat with the steak.  unfortunately again, the filet mignon was overcooked and chewy.  yes, you read right, chewy!  filet mignon!  i was very disappointed.  stk is a steakhouse and their steak was <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> the only thing i would not get again.  maybe they were having an off night or an off-piece, but how do you mess up such a fine cut like filet!?!  

mushroom pot pie:  this side dish was the highlight of our side dishes - a must get!  it's <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> of probably 4-5 different mushroom type, baked under some dough to soak in all the delicious sauce.  it was one of those unique dishes that are not offered in many pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>, but tastes super awesome!  

if you have a big group and are celebrating an event, this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> is a good option.  be prepared to pay some big bucks (but hey, you're in vegas!).

overall if i could do this every time i went to vegas i would!

 crispy on the outer edge and creamy on the inside.  the spin<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and the potatoes were a little under salted for me but i think they do it so you catch more of the steaks flavor versus having too rich of a side.  to finish things off we all ordered a double espresso, a lemon cello and <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> chocolate peanut butter bars.    the whole experience was extremely top notch from start to finish and that is why i go to stk every time i'm in vegas.
