our steaks and our sides were absolutely delicious! the mac and cheese was creamy, the broccolini had a nice parmesan garlic flavor to it, and our steaks were cooked to perfection. i added a side of chimichurri sauce and that made my steak even more heavenly. as soon as we finished our meal, luis found out from the hostess that we were celebrating an anniversary, and brought us <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> dessert! the desserts consisted of a warm apple crisp and <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> cheesecake. both desserts were scrumptious and after eating there, i was afraid the zipper on my desk would rip! lol. we ended up also chatting with another worker named chris who gave us some recommendations on things to do that were nearby. he also explained how he enjoyed working at stk because of how the staff feels like a family since they also hang out after work. 

luis and chris, you guys are amazing! one of you told us that anyone who comes in is treated like vip at stk, and i truly believe it. the food and <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> service is why we will be returning to eat there in the future, every time we make a trip out to vegas. thank you for making our 4 year anniversary very memorable for the both of us!

we came at a perfect time, when the noise level was at an appropriate level. from everything that i've read and heard, the loud head-poun<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> music can be a turn off for those who yearn for a romantic candle-lit <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>, where you can <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> hear e<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> other conversate and not just pretend to be. so my tip for you would be book your reservation at a really early time, our was for 5:30pm. 

i requested a booth so that we could have more seating and arm room. my request was readily <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> for. our server was really sweet and genuine. i had to wait for <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> for over 30min even though the pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> was not quite p<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> yet, but i guess they had to go get a watermelon so she told me <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> would be on the house.

we started off with the beef carp<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> w/ pesto angel hair, fried lobster tail and crab salad w/ honeydew and grapefruit. everything was delish, and balanced e<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> other very nicely. 

the hub<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> the porterhouse and i ended up w/ the bone-in-filet topped w/ foie gras. sides were truffle parmesan fries, brocollini and corn pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>. our steaks were cooked to perfection, but the stk sauce that we chose didn't complement it very well. i wished our steak was seasoned just a bit more, so that no sauce was needed. after our request for a1 came, it made everything so much better!! <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> had too much fillers and not enough corn so i would skip out on that next time. i loved my thick cut truffle fries, but it was way too pungent tasting for the hubs. 

as for dessert, we just had to get the sweet potato donuts! we were so full, but luckily the donuts were light and airy. we had an enjoyable evening, but i'm not sure if we would be b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> w/ all the many vegas options there is that we have yet to try.

considering we were guests of cosmopolitan, i was excited to learn stk was in the hotel.  i've been to other locations in dc and nyc.. but the rest of my party first time. 

long story short, the hostess made every attempt on getting us to leave. our reservation which was made 2 weeks prior wasn't honored, we were shuffled around the <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> area because the hostess confused two groups, one of 4 other of 5 (our group and the other only had one thing in common). they seat us at a bar table. this was my best friends 40th birthday, which i noted on the reservation... i've sat at the bar for many years with 40 years plus on this earth, i couldn't stand for it!!  

after my complaint, they then seat us in the b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> by the kitchen. the waiter was witty so we decided to stay... we order, receive our food - all of it was cold and had to be sent b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> (at this point we hoped for the best, but really should've left). it was so bad that one person in the party just opted not to eat. (very sad f<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>)

the waiter was great (sorry didn't catch his name) ...we really appreciated him for making up for the hostesses many attempts on trying to get us to leave. it's unfortunate this happened because i raved to my friends on how much i loved this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>... :(

wow. i really enjoyed this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>. i've never been to a steakhouse with a real nightclub feel and thought it was perfect for vegas. i think you have to be have to be ready to party when you come here. the bar area had a very social feel which was nice to have before sitting. we went there since our "table wasn't ready" but i think its by design to get us to grab some drinks at the bar before sitting. i say that because when we sat down there was a few open tables that appeared to not be filled for awhile. our server was fast and on point with good knowledge of the menu. my ribeye was cooked to my medium rear liking with a nice sear on  the outside just like i like it. mashed potatos were fantastic. they did under cook one person at our tables filet mignon, but he was too polite to send it b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to be cooked longer. steakhouse usually error on that side so they can always throw it in longer. the point off for the visit was strictly because they didn't serve prime steak, but charged "prime" prices. the steaks were angus though a very tasty! i'm going to orlando in march and hope to eat at their new pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> down there too!

well you're in vegas, and you want some steak.  i hope you just hit a hot roll at <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> table, cause you'll need it <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> at this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>.  don't get me wrong, the steaks are great, but you def pay for what you get.  plus there's a dj with an attr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> atmosphere (people, aka female people), so you'll get the full vegas experience.

i would skip the seafood tower, and just focus on the meat and load up (share) some sides.  the seafood tower is grand and looks cool among other tables, but the value just isn't there.  especially if e<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> oyster or claw works out to be like $20 a piece.  the sauce that it comes with are really awesome though.  so maybe you can just get some bowls of that!

like mastros, stk is a part of the new wave of modern steakhouses - loud rock music, tattooed wait staff, dim lighting, etc. it's more like a nightclub that serves excellent cuisine. 

but enough about the decor...

we were a party of 8 and literally everything was delicious. <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark>... the steaks... the sides... the dessert.... all of it was well worth every penny. the parmesan fries and corn pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> were highlights as was the peppercorn crusting on the meats. i had the filet which was cooked perfectly. plus they do bone-in as an option. 

now stk isn't cheap. in f<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> it's a tad overpriced relative to portion size. plus the appetizers were not as exceptional as the rest of the meal. but... i can say this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> is definitely one of the top steakhouses i've eaten in.

ok ! we got b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> from las vegas last week and we had a reservation at stk steakhouse in vegas which of course gave us the opportunity to see what we were missing. we arrived 10 minutes before our scheduled reservation but there wasn't a problem we were about 18 people they seated us and very efficiently,the waitstaff was very <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and explained anything that we wanted to know about the menu, the decour i would say is modern the noise level wasn't bad at all it was easy to converse without screaming some of these restaurants in vegas tend to be very loud but again that's vegas! now for our meal we started out with <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> fish platter consisting of oysters on the half shell shrimp ceviche alaskan king crab and clams on the half shell (little necks) the presentation was very nice the alaskan king crab all cr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> open for you,the drinks from the bar were very good and they served us within 15 minutes remember we were 18 people, now to the main course i had a peppercorn crusted bone in ribeye 24 ounce i received my steak and it was prepared just the way i like my steak medium rare! my wife orde<mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> sea bass which was excellent! the parmesan fries is a must-have!! also <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> if you don't have it you will definitely regret it!the prices are a little on the high side but that's what you expect in a good steakhouse and this is a good steakhouse! 

                                                             bon app\u00e9tit,  joe d.

staff is great here! ambiance is cool, location is nice. good people watching pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>. i've seen some of <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> dresses while eating here. so dress cute/hot. always good music. the food is delicious, try the dover sole (one of the best on the strip). <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> is always good,fun, happy, wi<mark>Malbec, Terrazas De Los Andes Altos Del Plata, AR 13</mark> range.

first, my wife is from a family of cattle ranchers so she knows beef and she loved this stk! 

from the oysters to the bread to the main dish, this is one fun, loud, happy pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>. 

the burrata salad was fantastic, the potatoes were great as was the wine list...i don't a single bad word to say. 

ambiance=5
food=8
service=12
drinks=8

it's off <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> good!

glad i went. btw, not as pricy as people say. and worth every penny!!!

we had a group of 14 and needed a same day reservation on a saturday for <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> at 10pm. stk handled this problem with great style! they put us in a private room and gave us leslie, the best server i have ever had. from beginning to end this server filled our <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> party with personality and fun. she was attentive and bright and had <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> smile. our meals.... amazing! short ribs... amazing.... ahi appetizer....amazing! the filet, perfect! oysters, spin<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>, mashed potatoes, too much to list... all of it so tasty! from a group from la who <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> regularly at 5 star restaurants this was a top notch experience! thank you stk and leslie!

we came here on a saturday night during a girl's trip to celebrate a birthday. the atmosphere is just what we wanted; upscale but also fun, the server was awesome and let us take our time, made great recommendations, and the food was all delicious. we had the burrata, a wedge salad, <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> entree, mac and cheese, mashed potatoes and broccolini - all shared family style. the server brought the salad out chopped so it was easy to share and had <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> sliced for us in the kitchen, without us asking. definitely the best restaurant i have been to on the strip and a good model for restaurant owners to base server training on. will be b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> during future vegas trips for sure!

stayed at <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark>. i was not impressed with the food we ordered filet, lamp chops, steaks, rib eye, potato mash, salads etc! party of 5 on a tuesday night in vegas for a business <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>, we were unable to have <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> because the music was too loud. the service was excellent plus the runners. however the food was just very bland and tasteless. spend your $ somewhere else for a good steak <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> unless you want to sit in a restaurant that sounds like a nightclub.

i came to las vegas for a business conference and one of my managers recommended this restaurant. it is everything you think of when you watch tv shows like "sex and <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark>!" it is modern, hip, refined, elegant and caters to the uppity 30 to 50 year old crowd. 

everyone from the restaurant staff to customers were dressed to impress. i felt like i was in that movie "oceans 11" with george clooney..

i came with a party of 5 and we ordered several different steaks and side dishes, as well as wine and dessert.

appetizers:

they give you this baked loaf of bread with parmesan and garlic sprinkled over the top. it comes with a dipping sauce of herb infused butter oil. it is really a tasty treat.


salad: they have a great salad that comes with goat cheese, greens and balsamic vinegar drizzled over it. it is kind of a small salad, but it is quite tasty.


entrees:

i ordered the 14 ounce filet steak that is cooked on the bone. my waiter recommended that its better to get the steak that is cooked on the bone, because the meat is more flavorful and juicy. when they serve the meat, it is deboned, and it is was very good. i ordered it medium and it came out and was super tender, but still dense and so it felt like a real steak and not just soft. it was very tasty and you can order a few sides with your meal.

my colleagues also ordered different steaks and they all enjoyed their various entrees. 

we ordered several different sides and i would rate them as the following:

creamy corn:  this was herb infused corn with creamy goodness. it had the texture of mashed potatoes, but it was a very robu<mark>Zinfandel, St. Francis, Sonoma, CA 12</mark> flavor.

jalapeno cheese grits:   green jalapeno pureed with melted cheese and infused into the grits. it had a spicy kick and it was pretty good.

mushroom pot pie:    this is a great dish to order on the side. its basically mushrooms saut\u00e9ed with caramelized onions and cream sauce in a little pot pie. i enjoyed scooping out the mushrooms and drizzling them over my steak. the flavor combination was intense.


the wine list is pretty good and we ordered a bottle of pinot noir. i forgot which one, but the waiter said its very popular and you should buy this in a full bottle.


dessert:   they have a pist<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and strawberry cake that is baked on an almond and marzipan coated crust. it is served with whipped cream and drizzled with strawberry sauce and its amazing! it is very light and not too heavy and a great way to end your meal.


this is a pricy restaurant, but its worth visiting when you are in vegas for a special <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> or night out with friends. one of the better steakhouses in las vegas!

awesome atmosphere! great pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> to have <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> with a group of people, or a date. <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> bread was a definite winner! my braised short rib fell short in the flavor department, but was extremely tender.

i can't believe i never reviewed after checking in!! let me just say that as far as happy hours go this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> is the bee's knees!! its classy and fun, the food is just to die for!

yeah....   this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>... wow.

great service, great food, great music (slightly loud but yeah...  the dj was playing 80's rock songs with a bit of trendier twist to them).  

ask for brian - he was awesome.  top notch service!  

i ordered bone-in rib steak and it was perfectly cooked to medium rare, perfectly seasoned.  i ordered the red wine sauce... and it was just okay, but i didn't need the sauce at all.  (i usually eat my steak without sauces though).  

we also ordered 3 different sides.  my favorite was mushroom pot pie.  it tastes like truffle bisque soup trapped in a...  pot pie.  hard to describe this one but man... it was awesome.   grit and corn were great as well.  

very highly recommended.  ask for brian!

look, i get it. in vegas, you're paying for experience as much as you're paying for food. however, at the premium prices of stk, i'd a least like a little bit of "wow" with my meal. i ordered the salmon dish, and my wife got the strip. we both had the same re<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>: "it's fine".

food was great. we had the lobster mash and the rib eye steak....it was amazing! brad was our server and i have to say it was ok. for a high end restaurant i was a bit disappointed. my girlfriends and i wanted to have a great birthday <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> and catch up without feeling rushed through <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>. we can tell he was a tad annoyed because attitude changed when we told him we were in no hurry and we wanted to take our time. it was clear to us he wanted to turn tables. it's not like we were not consuming because we were ordering drinks left and right! not sure if i would come b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> here. food was great but it all about the service don't you think? so 3 stars for service!

few meals in vegas stood out but this one definitely did.

why it's stkastic +'s:
+ bone in filet. get it medium rare plus otherwise it just won't be bloody enough.
+ cocktails are strong. 
+ garlic bread served in break-off molds. perfect! i love just grabbing a piece off rather than cutting through it.
+ side that stood out: parmesan truffle fries are all the rage and the thick cuts are perfect.
+ fun dj on a saturday night that got guests out of their table to dance.
+ great friendly service.

why i'll slip out -'s:
- wines start at $80 per bottle. not my thing.
- sides are $15 extra e<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>.
- forgettable sides to pass: burrata, romaine (meh it's alright), lobster tail because it's $30 and mushroom pot pie because crust was paper thin.

before tip we hit $800 for five persons that included steaks for all, two bottles of wine, round of cocktails, 5 apps, 5 sides and no dessert.

overall i'd return because it was a fun atmosphere with a good crowd. gets loud and raise your voice to be heard.

i had the best experience here the ambiance is great  music bumping through out the restaurant , the people are good looking we opt for the 3 lbs crab stuffed lobster with a side of steak for 3 girls to share , the meal was prepared well as well as presentation, i will return to vegas soon and return to this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>

closes later than other steakhouses. i didn't want to rush to a different steakhouse 30min before their closing time. 

came on a monday night. took 5-10min to get a table. it was crazy loud and pr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> like <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>. wasn't a big fan of that. our waiter was super polite and friendly. checked on us regularly. 

yellowtail appetizer was yummy. fresh and it surprisingly goes well with apples. it also has <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> sauce that comes with it. 
my boyfriends bone-in ribeye was okay. wasn't juicy enough. had better. 
i got the bone-in filet. asked for medium rare. was slightly over cooked in my opinion. but the portion by the bone was amazing.
we both got the stk sauce. their house steak sauce was sweeter than i expected. the boyfriend wasn't a big fan, but i thought it was okay. i think the stk bold would have been a better choice. 
we sha<mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> corn pud<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>. that was a favorite. tasted like a sweet mashed potato with pieces of corn. 

overall, the food was okay.

this was among the best meals i have ever had. when choosing a location for my birthday <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> i went b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and forth and eventually we settled on stk. we made a reservation and went. truly, everything about this pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> was phenomenal. the service was on point, the food was amazing and the atmosphere was so much fun, i mean, really, a dj spinning at <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>? ok!

our service was wonderful. we were checked on at all the appropriate times, our server was attentive but never pushy and clearly knew the menu very well. 

i started with the shrimp rice krispies and then had <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> filet with a side of mac & cheese for <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>. everything was amazing. i still can't get over the taste of the mac & cheese. oh, and did i mention the bread? yeah, amazing.

finally, the atmosphere was so much fun and the people watching was phenomenal. i love people watching and there were lots of interesting and unique people to watch while <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> at stk. there was also a dj spinning but the music was kept at a very reasonable volume so that we could enjoy our <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> company.

oysters were frozen...drinks were $18 and nothing special, yet we were billed $22 per drink and they "made a mistake" and added $40 extra to our tab...they corrected it, but a very odd mistake considering we were the only patrons in the bar.  will not be going b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>.
what a great cut of steak. got a moscow mule to <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> this and a selection of lobster appetizers.
dish_name: Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13

text:
updated review: (marked down to 3 stars).

we had such a great experience here during the grand opening that we decided to go b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> a week later with a friend visiting from out of town.  the experience was not as great.  here is the low down:

host staff:  clueless.
we made reservations a few days in advance and asked to sit with our server from our first visit.  on the night of our <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> we arrived 20 minutes early to see plenty of open tables but the hostess was absolutely clueless on what to do with us.  uh, seat us maybe?  we gave her a break and decided to sit in the lounge for a drink while she sorted it out but after 30 minutes (10 minutes after our reservation) we never got appro<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> about our table (except for the wrong name - "are you mr. kluss"?) and so we had to go b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> up to the stand to find out what was going on with the <mark>Malbec, Terrazas De Los Andes Altos Del Plata, AR 13</mark>.  the hostess seemed like she was making an excuse up (similar to lost homework judging from her age) as to why our table still wasn't ready and so we ended up having to talk to another hostess to get it right.  when they finally went to sit us down it wasn't in the servers area we had twice requested (once during our reservation a week before and once when we arrived).  when we let her know of the mistake the hostess seating us (a different one) made some rude remark about how 'messed up' things were here and sat us down in the section we requested.  not a good tee-off to a $260 <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> for 3.

<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>: too slow and with mistakes.
the best part of <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> was the demeanor from or original server.  she was a real pro and as cool as we remembered the first time but seemed to be hamstrung by the slow kitchen service and a few lapses in attention to detail from there - missing or slow items she had to notice and then retrieve.  i'm no stranger to fine <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> and a slow p<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> is nice but it took a good 40 minutes just to get our apps - thats too long.  overall the food was just "okay" for as long as we waited and for the price.  i've been much more impressed at half a dozen other steakhouses in town (the palm @ caesars, capital grill, ruths chris's, del friscos, flemings etc).  really surprised too that <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> were made so inconsistently (in taste) because how complicated is <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>?  it was so left to right that we had to keep saying something to the point that the server felt bad enough to finally bring us an extra (right) one for free.

summary:
like the other reviewer our trouble started with the front host staff and unfortunately continued with slow service.  as native las vegans we like <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> a lot as far as hotels go and may give stk another shot after we've tried the other restaurants at the hotel first.  the layout is great, the decor, the music and the overall vibe are solid too but as far as service goes and food that blows you away goes - maybe they just have opening week issues.

caveat emptor.

i'd give it 2.5 stars but someone needs to fix the music issue and hopefully a low side vote will encourage it.  (btw, there is a big fr<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> knob for the volume. turn it counter-clockwise)

** sweet potato donuts.  you might not think of stk as a dessert destination, but these divine donuts might change your mind.  sweet potato made for an unusual twist on <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> donut, and a gooey and decadent pecan glaze brought it all together.  heaven!

service was outstan<mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>.  pretty much everyone on the staff looks like a model, with sex appeal dripping out of every pore -- but don't expect "vanderpump rules"-style drama or catty behavior.  quite <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> -- the staff at stk are 100% professional and courteous, and quite friendly.  the p<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> of the dishes was nice and steady, and we were never felt rushed or pressured to leave, even as we lingered over glasses of wine for maybe ~30 min after we had paid our tab.

i was definitely impressed by stk.  the whole experience was prfct.

i ate here with my wife and her sister and brother in law the last time we came to vegas. we were given some food credit at <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> so we decided to use it at stk. we ordered the tuna tartare as an appetizer. it was pretty small to share for 4 people but is pretty good for 2. it tasted very delicious for the small portion it was. the house bread they offered was really good. for the main course, i ordered the bone-in rib steak. the steak was to die for. the steak was really tender and full of flavor. you didn't need to have extra sauces or toppings. it was fine as is. we also ordered the 3 mac and cheese si<mark>Malbec, Terrazas De Los Andes Altos Del Plata, AR 13</mark> also the brussels sprouts. the sides were pretty bomb! just beware, the 3 mac and cheese side was around $55. it isn't on the menu but it was really good and glad we ordered it.

the inside of the restaurant is really nice. the decor is very modern. it is located inside of <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> on the 3rd floor. i'd definitely eat here again if i could. the steak was amazing and definitely worth trying!

wow!  this is what i have been waiting all week for in vegas!  you can't help but feel just a little bit cooler for having eaten at stk.  from the moment you walk in, the hostesses, the managers, bartenders, servers, and <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> are all outgoing, excited, high energy, beautiful, and cool people.  in f<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>, i was probably the most uncool person in the pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> - haha.  top it off with some delicious food and some great beats coming out the speakers and a night out at stk is better than a great night in <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark>.  ok - not really, but it is a whole lot better way to spend your money than a bad night at the tables!

since stk is in <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark>, you would expect it to be a little on the hipster side - and that is not meant in a bad way - and it does not disappoint.  <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> may be <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> bar on the strip and stk complements it well.  as i mentioned, the atmosphere is on the loud side with mostly old skool hip hop playing - probably not the best pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> if you are looking for a quiet romantic or business <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>.

our service team was very attentive, knowledgeable, and <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>.  

i had the petite filet, which was done perfectly.  the table had all kinds of sides, but i particularly enjoyed the truffle fries, mushrooms, and creamed corn.

for dessert, the server whipped up a little sampler plate for the table, which was excellent.  

one downside is that they only have single bathrooms so the line was a little long - although i imagine you could find one just outside the restaurant.  

be sure to make reservations because the room is a little on the small si<mark>Malbec, Terrazas De Los Andes Altos Del Plata, AR 13</mark> be sure to bring <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> card because the bill will be a little on the big side.

if you are in vegas to celebrate something special or you just want to live like one of the beautiful people for the night - get dressed up and head over to stk.

i don't think i can say enough about how perfect our experience was at stk!!! the hostesses had smiles as soon as we entered and were very friendly! our server, chris, was at our table less than 1 minute after we were seated to take our drink orders. <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> were amazing!!!! we told him we were in a slight rush to catch a show and he immediately started telling us about their menu! he was very knowledgable when it came to what was on everything and was very entertaining! the young man who helped with our waters, marcus, was on his game!!! my glass never was empty, which is a big <mark>Malbec, Terrazas De Los Andes Altos Del Plata, AR 13</mark> to me. this all before we even got our food!! 
the food was perfection!!! we all ordered steaks and they were all cooked ex<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> as we had wanted! the sides were amazing as well! the mac and cheese...yumm!!!! i have never been so impressed by a restaurant and it's whole team as i was by the team at stk! you didn't see servers on their phones or messing around but you could tell everyone was having a good time! i will definitely be returning to stk on my next trip to vegas!!! nothing short of perfection!!!!

i've been wanting to go here for quite some time and we finally had the opportunity the other night. 

walking in, it reminded me of an old lounge from the 60s, but in 2015! maybe it was the raised <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> room and the half moon booths? whatever it was, i very much enjoyed it! the atmosphere was loud and very sexy, but the setting was perfect because we could still have an intimate conversation at our table. 

to start, they brought us the delicious bleu cheese butter bread and this tantalizing sauce to go with it. it was like <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>, garlic, olive oil blend and it was nothing like i've ever tasted before. it had us all craving more!

next, we ordered the beef carp<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> with these wonderful pesto noodles. highly recommend this dish and it still stands out to us, even the next day.

for <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark>, we went a little crazy. we had to try some of these unique sides! my personal favorites were the mushroom pot pie and the original mac and cheese. our server (who was lovely and i can't remember name!) recommended getting truffle mashed potatoes and keeping the mac and cheese to a regular order. i'm so happy we did this. we loved that mac and cheese so much, we ended up ordering another one  
we also shared the 38oz cowboy ribeye (sliced in the kitchen-thank you again to our server for that suggestion)
the steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare with <mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>, charred layer on the outsi<mark>Malbec, Terrazas De Los Andes Altos Del Plata, AR 13</mark> a warm cool center. it melted in my mouth.

hands down, one of the best <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> i've had in vegas. make a reservation because you'll certainly need one for this p<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> house! and rightfully so, i cannot wait to go b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> for another delicious meal!

my wife and i split the porterhouse combo, a large porterhouse steak, plus three sides, we ordered the jalapeno grits, mac n cheese and the mushrooms. mushrooms were a bit dry, seasoning was really good. very classy mac n cheese, but kind of dry. lastly, the jalapeno grits might have been sitting out for too long because it was room temperature. luckily, what i really liked about this experience was the star of the show, the porterhouse steak which was delicious beyond words. seasoning was done just right, medium well, it was juicy and melt in your mouth good. i was extremely impressed with this omaha based steak and i can proudly say i've eaten omaha steaks in omaha! this steak was done perfectly, i couldn't have added one thing to make it better.

seating is a little tight, i felt like the atmosphere was too intimate, we were sitting so close to other tables. it is loud insi<mark>Malbec, Terrazas De Los Andes Altos Del Plata, AR 13</mark>, nevertheless, very friendly staff, professional and on top of everything. i liked the overall experience and wouldn't mind coming b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> here again!

my husband and i frequent <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> and always have <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> at stk when we are in town.  this most recent visit did not disappoint, as usual.  we always ask for our "favorite" staff when we are in town and this time were able to see rima, but brenden and grayson were not working.  oh well, we had the pleasure of being served by krissi (sp?) this time and she was just as fabulous as the rest of the staff!  we love stk so much not only because of the food, but the service is impeccable and the staff takes the time to get to know you and always treats you as a vip (maybe because we are? ;)) so just a few comments about the food.  i ordered the sea bass and cleaned my plate!  it was delicious!  my husband always loves the bone-in filet and said it was amazing as always.  my husband tried <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> jalape\u00f1o grits and can't wait to order them again.  as for dessert, the sweet potato donuts are a must have.  we can't wait to come b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>!  

we are planning to <mark>Stellina Di Notte, Prosecco, Veneto, Italy NV</mark> at the <mark>Malbec, Terrazas De Los Andes Altos Del Plata, AR 13</mark> stk on september 5th as my husband will be celebrating his 50th bday.  i am so excited to have this fabulous restaurant in our b<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark> and hope that the staff here is as wonderful as the staff in vegas!  see you soon!

staff is great here! ambiance is cool, location is nice. good people watching pl<mark>Pinot Noir, a by Acacia, CA 13</mark>. i've seen some of <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> dresses while eating here. so dress cute/hot. always good music. the food is delicious, try the dover sole (one of the best on the strip). <mark>Red Blend, the Prisoner, Napa <mark>Cabernet Sauvignon, Jordan, Alexander Valley, CA 11</mark> 13</mark> is always good,fun, happy, wi<mark>Malbec, Terrazas De Los Andes Altos Del Plata, AR 13</mark> range.
